name: Kepler-428
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-428 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-428 is a star with 0.87 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8 times its radius. It is located 2348.32 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-428 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-428 system


Kepler-428 b

Kepler-428 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-428 b is 403.86 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-428 b is 12.11 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-428 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-428, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
